dt: {bc}ostentatious or showy often beyond the bounds of good taste

pt: {sc}gaudy{/sc} {sc}tawdry{/sc} {sc}garish{/sc} {sc}flashy{/sc} {sc}meretricious{/sc} mean vulgarly or cheaply showy. {sc}gaudy{/sc} implies a tasteless use of overly bright, often clashing colors or excessive ornamentation.
{sc}tawdry{/sc} applies to what is at once gaudy and cheap and sleazy.
{sc}garish{/sc} describes what is distressingly or offensively bright.
{sc}flashy{/sc} implies an effect of brilliance quickly and easily seen to be shallow or vulgar.
{sc}meretricious{/sc} stresses falsity and may describe a tawdry show that beckons with a false allure or promise.

pt.t: a {it}meretricious{/it} wasteland of casinos and bars

shortdef: lacking in substance or flavor : insipid
